intro: Cynoglossospermum macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered swallowworts, is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
